title: Empty top-level doc comment causes panic when trying to run doc tests (index out of bounds).

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code A minimal example involves a brand new lib crate (`cargo new --lib bug_report`) with a single file containing code: `src/lib.rs`. Both `cargo test` and `cargo doc` cause a panic when reaching the doc tests. If there is text in the top-level doc comment, the panic doesn't happen. Contents of `src/lib.rs`: ```Rust /*! */ pub fn foo() { println!("Foo!"); } #[cfg(test)] mod tests { #[test] fn should_be_fine() { () } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.60.0 (7737e0b5c 2022-04-04) binary: rustc commit-hash: 7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c commit-date: 2022-04-04 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.60.0 LLVM version: 14.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` dan@lauDANum:~/dev/bug_report$ RUST_BACKTRACE=full cargo test Finished test [unoptimized + debuginfo] target(s) in 0.00s Running unittests (target/debug/deps/bug_report-c2e012fdc0118790) running 1 test test tests::should_be_fine ... ok test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s Running unittests (target/debug/deps/bug_report-40b3e22a725fc2c3) running 0 tests test result: ok. 0 passed; 0 failed; 0 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out; finished in 0.00s Doc-tests bug_report thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', compiler/rustc_ast/src/util/comments.rs:55:28 ```
Backtrace

``` stack backtrace: 0: 0x7ff9054ee86d - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::hee598835bc88d35b at /rustc/7737e0b5c4103216d6fd8cf941b7ab9bdbaace7c/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7ff9054ee86d -
